condition.narrative: Section 1.E.3. The Recipient shall ensure that for each activity under the Project of a type for which the ESSAP provides that anESMP should be prepared, such ESMP shall within four (4) months of the Effective Date be prepared, in form and substancesatisfactory to the Association, and disclose it locally and at the Bank’s InfoShop, before the implementation of such activity, inaccordance with the provisions of the ESMF, and the relevant activity is implemented in accordance with its ESMP.

Section 1.E.4. The Recipient shall, moreover, ensure that for each activity of a type for which the ESSAP provides that a RAPshould be prepared, such RAP shall within four (4) months of the Effective Date be prepared in form and substance satisfactory tothe Association, (including without limitation to the above, the provision of funds for resettlement compensation when and ifrequired under said RAP), and disclosed locally and at the Bank’s InfoShop, before the implementation of such activity, inaccordance with the provisions of the ESSAP, and the relevant activity is implemented in accordance with its RAP.

Section I.C.2. The Recipient shall furnish to the Association, not later than November 30 of each year, the annual work plans andbudgets approved by the PSC for the Association’s review and approval; except for the annual work plan and budget for the Projectfor the first year of Project implementation, which shall be furnished no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date. Onlythe activities included in an annual work plan and budget expressly approved by the Association (each an “Annual Work Plan andBudget”) are eligible to a financing from the proceeds of the Financing.

Section II.A.1. The Recipient shall monitor and evaluate the progress of the Project and prepare Project Reports in accordance withthe provisions of Section 4.08 of the General Conditions and on the basis of indicators acceptable to the Association. EachProject Report shall cover the period of one calendar semester and shall be furnished to the Association not later than 45 daysafter the end of the period covered by such report.

Section II.B.2. The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association not later than 45 days after the end of each calendarquarter interim unaudited financial reports for the Project covering the quarter, in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation.

Section II.B.3.The Recipient shall have its Financial Statements audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 4.09 (b) ofthe General Conditions. Each audit of the Financial Statements shall cover the period of one fiscal year of the Recipient. Theaudited Financial Statements for each such period shall be furnished to the Association not later than six months after the end ofsuch period.
Section II.B.4. The Recipient shall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date recruit and thereafter retain anexternal auditor.
Section II.B.5. The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date install a customized accountingsoftware.

title.narrative: Percentage (in value) of exceptional expenditures, excluding salaries and debt.
Transparency composite indicator (Composite indicator Specific to the Central African Republic based on 21 core budget reports.

baseline.value: Audits of the HR - payroll undertaken – HR and Payroll database in the process of being interconnected.

target.value: Audit of the HR and Payroll database

actual.value: Achieved: HR and Payroll audit completed

title.narrative: Timely submission of annual financial statements (Compte de Gestion, Compte Administrative, and Loi de Règlement).

baseline.value: Backlog of 2009-2016 Compte de Gestion, Compte Administrative, and Loi de Règlement.

target.value: Financial Statements for 2019 submitted within 9 months to Court of auditors and to Parliament within 12 months.

actual.value: 2017 Financial Statement were deposited to the Court of Account in October 2018 (on time for the 9 months target after the end ofthe fiscal year). The Accounts were deposited to the Parliament in 2020 (more than 15 months delay from the target). The 2018Statement were deposited to the Court of Account in December 2019 (3 months delay from the target of 9 months of the end of fiscalyear). The Loi de reglement is in preparation but has not been deposited to the Parliament.The 2019 financial statement areexpected were deposited in September 2021, with 20 months delay due mainly to the Covid-19 pandemic and the violence that affectedthe country at the end of 2020 and early 2021.

title.narrative: Improved budget reporting and information to line ministries (Process)

target.value: Execution reports published using a functional and administrative, nomenclature within eight weeks of the end of the quarter andcommitment ceiling communicated to sector ministries quarterly

actual.value: Budget execution reports are produced quarterly and on time within 8 weeks of the end of quarter and published on the MFB website.Reports using the functional classification are not available.

target.value: All core modules operational in the MFB

actual.value: All modules: budget preparation, budget execution, treasury, accounting and revenue management modules have been delivered. Thebudget preparation module is in use as of September 2021 (for the preparation of 2022 budget). Other modules will be in use fromJanuary 1st 2022 onward (using the budget prepared under SIMBA)

target.value: Intermediary accounting reports are prepared quarterly within six weeks of the end of the quarter

actual.value: In addition to quarterly budget execution reports, the treasury produces a quarterly accounting report including situation of ClassIV, V, VI, VII accounts. A quarterly Treasury meeting and reporting is held (comité de Trésorerie). These are not constantlyproduced on time within the six weeks threshold.

target.value: Public procurement plans for all concerned ministries and at least 30% of bid opportunities and awards published

actual.value: Some notices of call for bids and some notices of attribution have been published on the website of the Finance Ministry in 2018,2019, 2020, 2021. Annual Procurement Plans have been published for all ministries.

target.value: Yes (at least one in the past three years)

actual.value: The audit for 2017 and 2018 have been finalized and audit for 2019 is ongoing.Finalized Audit still need to be published.

title.narrative: Public investment projects are prioritized on the basis of published standard criteria for project selection

actual.value: No: One part of the investment manual has been finalized, detailing the general principles of selection of public investment.Detailed criteria have not been developed.

title.narrative: Annual and bi-annual reviews of RCPCA
Annual reviews of RCPCA incorporating feedback from citizens' consultations
Public Investment report (bi-annual and annual) publicly disclosed
New regulation, procedures and processes adopted (Process)

baseline.value: Regulation, procedures and processes in need of updating.

target.value: New Chart of Account and budget classification applied.

actual.value: Achieved: The new frameworks have been adopted and translated into the SIMBA system and will be implemented from the preparation ofthe 2022 budget(from September 2021). Organic law of finance adopted by the National Assembly was promulgated. Implementationdecrees related to (i) the Government New Chart of Accounts; (ii) Government Finance Table; (iii) Budget Classification; (iv)Accounting Regulations and Standards have been signed in April 2019.
